title: Translanguaging Pedagogy Design for EMI-Based STEM Education

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic STEM concepts and secondary-level English reading comprehension
context.additional_context: A course for non-major adult learners to develop language and cognitive strategies for acquiring STEM content in EMI (English-Medium Instruction) environments, designed with modular learning using mobile devices.

learning_goals: Learners can accurately interpret over 80% of STEM-related English academic texts
Learners can flexibly transition between their native language and English when explaining STEM concepts using translanguaging strategies
Learners can perform peer assessments and provide feedback through digital collaboration tools
In EMI (English as a Medium of Instruction) environments, learners can complete assignments utilizing scientific argumentation structures (claim-evidence-reasoning)
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
